thread.title: 2nd ODI: Zimbabwe opt to bowl against unchanged India -
thread.title_full: 2nd ODI: Zimbabwe opt to bowl against unchanged India - The Times of India

author: timesofindia.indiatimes.com
title: 2nd ODI: Zimbabwe opt to bowl against unchanged India -
text:
NEW DELHI: Zimbabwe captain Elton Chigumbura won the toss and opted to bowl first in the second ODI of the three-match series against India at Harare on Sunday.
Scorecard
Zimbabwe have made one change to their playing XI bringing in Neville Madziva in place of injured Tinashe Panyangara while India are unchanged.
After winning the toss second time in a row, Chigumbura hoped his bowlers can repeat the performance of the first ODI when they had reduced India to 87/5 at one stage.
"We must ensure that we do the same thing, improve by that one percent in batting. If we can get India down to the same position (as in the previous match), we will be happy," he said after the toss.
On the other hand, India skipper Ajinkya Rahane stressed on the need of settling in on a wicket that is expected to offer some movement in the early stages of the match.
"We are playing the same eleven. The boys are looking forward to the match. There will be some movement initially, if we can take our time, the wicket will get better later on. I am not sure what's a good score on this wicket, but we need to bat well," Rahane said.
India lead the three-match series 1-0 after securing a close four-run win in the first ODI on Friday.
Teams:
Zimbabwe: 1 Vusi Sibanda, 2 Chamu Chibhabha, 3 Hamilton Masakadza, 4 Elton Chigumbura(c), 5 Sean Williams, 6 Sikandar Raza, 7 Richmond Mutumbami(w), 8 Graeme Cremer, 9 Donald Tiripano, 10 Brian Vitori, 11 Neville Madziva
India: 1 M Vijay, 2 Ajinkya Rahane (captain), 3 Ambati Rayudu, 4 Manoj Tiwary, 5 Robin Uthappa (wk), 6 Kedar Jadhav, 7 Stuart Binny, 8 Harbhajan Singh, 9 Axar Patel, 10 Bhuvneshwar Kumar, 11 Dhawal Kulkarni
